title: Option `quarkus.http.host-enabled=false` disables not only http but socket as well
body:
### Describe the bug

I have application, which listens on UNIX socket (and unix socket only) and returns a json. After an update to the latest Quarkus snapshot, the app doesn't respond over the socket and shows, that it doesn't listen on any interface.
If option `quarkus.http.host-enabled=true`, the app works as expected.

### Expected behavior

```
2023-03-17 10:36:51,875 INFO  [io.quarkus] (Quarkus Main Thread) test-http-advanced 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT on JVM (powered by Quarkus 3.0.0.Alpha6) started in 2.401s. Listening on: unix:/tmp/io.quarkus.app.socket
2023-03-17 10:36:51,877 INFO  [io.quarkus] (Quarkus Main Thread) Profile dev activated. Live Coding activated.
```

### Actual behavior

```
2023-03-17 10:36:19,955 INFO  [io.quarkus] (Quarkus Main Thread) test-http-advanced 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT on JVM (powered by Quarkus 999-SNAPSHOT) started in 2.304s. Listening on: 
2023-03-17 10:36:19,957 INFO  [io.quarkus] (Quarkus Main Thread) Profile dev activated. Live Coding activated.
```

### How to Reproduce?

1. `git clone git@github.com:fedinskiy/reproducer.git -b socket-host`
2. `mvn clean verify -Dquarkus.platform.version=999-SNAPSHOT` this fails

Both ` mvn clean verify -Dquarkus.platform.version=999-SNAPSHOT -Dquarkus.http.host-enabled=true` and `mvn clean verify -Dquarkus.platform.version=3.0.0.Alpha6` work

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

6.0.18-300.fc37.x86_64

### Output of `java -version`

17.0.5, vendor: GraalVM Community

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

629b2f07dbe8854e30f61fc5e641da2f978d1d9b

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.7 (b89d5959fcde851dcb1c8946a785a163f14e1e29)

### Additional information

_No response_
